info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:46PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN INDIANA...WESTERN JEFFERSON...ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1145 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Knox to 6 miles east of Apollo. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Indiana, Punxsutawney, Clarion, Kittanning, Brookville, Rimersburg, Ford City, New Bethlehem, Clymer, Rural Valley, West Lebanon, and Sligo. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 55 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
